snippet: Heavily redacted documents showed top private equity firms agreeing among themselves on which would bid on takeover targets.
abstract: Court documents that lawyers for Bain Capital sought to keep secret depict the company and other leading private equity firms as unofficial partners in a bid-rigging conspiracy aimed at holding down prices on takeover targets; federal lawsuit, brought about by shareholders, names Bain, along with Goldman Sachs and the Blackstone Group, as defendants.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and PETER LATTMAN
byline.contributor: Peter Lattman reported from New York.

lead_paragraph: Heavily redacted documents showed top private equity firms agreeing among themselves on which would bid on takeover targets.

headline.seo: Documents Depict Equity Firms Like Bain as Colluding
headline.main: Equity Firms Like Bain Are Depicted as Colluding
headline.print_headline: Equity Firms Like Bain Are Depicted As Colluding
